articles.author: Connor Boyd
articles.title: Fears over fresh outbreak of Marburg virus that kills 90% of patients in Africa - Daily Mail
articles.description: A deadly cousin of Ebola, Marburg virus can kill between a quarter and 90 per cent of the people it infects. International travel has taken it from Africa to Europe twice in the past 40 years.
articles.content:
Two people are believed to have died from the extremely deadly Marburg virus in Ghana as officials gear up for a potential outbreak.
The patients, from the country's southern Ashanti region, were no… [+4750 chars]

articles.title: Germany starts rationing energy as Putin's gas cuts bite - live updates - The Telegraph
articles.description: The euro may hit parity with the dollar within days as fears grow that Vladimir Putin could cut off gas supplies to Europe.
articles.content:
Good morning. 
Germany has begun an unofficial process of rationing energy amid rising fears Putin's gas cuts could lead to blackouts this winter.
